availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Price Jr. (Louisville, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of William C. Price, Sr. and Elizabeth Price. Married to Lizzie U. Queen in Louisville, Kentucky, on April 5, 1860. Father of Sterling Price and Blanch Price. Attorney in Louisville in 1850. Attorney in Louisville in 1858. Attorney in Louisville in 1859. Attorney in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 7, p. 493.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Scott County, Lexington, p. 71B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482708, p. 208.
Louisville City Directory and Business Mirror for 1858-9, (Louisville: Hurd & Burrows, 1859), 140.
Henry Tanner, ed., The Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1859-60 (Louisville: Maxwell & Co., 1859), 186.
Henry Pirtle, ed., Rules of Proceeding of the Louisville Chancery Court (Louisville: Hull & Brother Printers, 1855), 22.
KYR-0001-004-0193.
